Highway 48, the one road that connects the border town of
to the rest of the country, passes through largely untouched jungle. The road crosses three large rivers, with each bridge being built in a small town. Tatai is the nearest of such towns to
and lies 19km to the west. The next town west is
Highway 48 is the only road. Several companies' buses serve the town, connecting it to
The town is tiny so get around on foot. Boats are available for trips on the river.
Marvel at nature. Take a boat trip.
Not much to buy. No bank or ATM.
The town's economy appears to be based mainly on it being a truck stop. Places to eat are plentiful.

value: name=Samphos Tatai Guest House and Restaurant
directions=East side of the bridge, north side of the road.

content=Quiet and comfortable simple rooms set back from the road. Electricity only until 10pm. Each room has a bathroom but no hot water. The mosquito nets are surprisingly devoid of holes. The restaurant serves good crabs.
directions=free pick up by boat from the west side of the bridge
content=Comfortable eco bungalows set out in the jungle. All meals and drinking water included. No air con, only fans.
directions=pick up by boat from the bridge

Tatai Waterfall is nearby. Other waterfalls are also accessible.
